main event: On 18 September 1954, multiple observers at Kimpo Air Base, Korea, reported seeing a bright object in the sky resembling sunlight reflected off polished aluminum.
interesting points: The object was observed for a duration of 11 to 13 minutes,The object was initially sighted at approximately 0557 local time and reported to control tower operators,Several eyewitnesses, including weather personnel and control tower operators, confirmed the sighting,The object was considered too bright to be a star despite Rigel being visible at that time,The final classification of the object was 'unidentified' as it did not match the trajectory of a weather balloon.
sighted object: one bright object in the sky
witness description: USAF personnel including tower controllers and weather observers
